page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Earls Barton is a village of some 6000 inhabitants.It lies 6 miles from Northampton and 4 miles from Wellingborough between the A45 and A4500 main roads.The Saxon church tower overlooks a crossroads formed by the junction of High St.,West St.,Station Rd., and Broad St/Doddington Rd.To the South is the R.Nene and a disused railway line. Around the Square are post 1600 stone buildings with some of Victorian brick.North of the church is a recreation ground.Modern housing estates are to the South,North and West while the Victorian development follows High St, with its 16th.century Manor House. The traditional shoe-making industry exists with an industrial estate and service industries.
